ð—¥ð—˜ð—¤ð—¨ð—˜ð—¦ð—§ ð—” ð—™ð—˜ð—”ð—§ð—¨ð—¥ð—˜ ð—¢ð—¡ ð—§ð—›ð—˜ ð—™ð—¢ð—¥ð—¨ð—

Tiptap ðŸ©° is a rich text editor that gives you control over of your text editor.

ð— ð—˜ð—¡ð—¨ð—¦

- Bubble menu: highlight a word and this menu pops up.
- Floating menu: appears in an empty line.

Both for classical editor and markdown. You can set a paragraph to Heading1 either by typingÂ âŒ˜ + âŒ¥ + ðŸ Â or by addingÂ #Â at the beginning of a paragraph.
See all of them here: https://tiptap.dev/api/keyboard-shortcuts

meta_data.name: ðŸ¤Œ Rich text editor (Tiptap.dev)
meta_data.plugin_instructions:
1. Place the element on the page
2. Feed it some initial content (plain text or HTML)
3. Save the HTML as output

Extras:
- build and wire your own menu
- floating menu
- bubble menu

AEL.caption: Doc ID
AEL.doc: the document's unique ID. This will be the name of the document that you will see on ð—µð˜ð˜ð—½ð˜€://ð—°ð—¼ð—¹ð—¹ð—®ð—¯.ð˜ð—¶ð—½ð˜ð—®ð—½.ð—±ð—²ð˜ƒ
AEL.name: docID

jwt_secret.caption: Which JWT secret to use
jwt_secret.doc: Key to use to sign the JWT key
jwt_secret.name: jwt_secret

AAh.caption: Bold
AAh.doc: Applies bold to current selection. Ctrl + B / Opt + B

ADJ.caption: url
ADJ.doc: The YouTube url of the video
ADJ.name: url

ADK.caption: width
ADK.doc: If you set the width at 100% on the Tiptap element on the editor, this will serve as min width.
ADK.name: width

ADL.caption: height
ADL.doc: If you set the width at 100% on the Tiptap element on the editor, this will serve as min height.
ADL.name: height

ACX.caption: Content
ACX.doc: Content to display in the editor. Can be HTML, plain text.
ACX.name: content

AFH.caption: preserveWhitespace
AFH.doc: By default, whitespace is collapsed as per HTML's rules. Pass true to preserve whitespace, but normalize newlines to spaces, and 'full' to preserve whitespace entirely.
AFH.name: parseOptions_preserveWhitespace

ACE.caption: Image
ACE.doc: Should be a valid URL. Accepts Base64.
ACE.name: insert_image

ADG.caption: Insert content
ADG.doc: adds the passed value to the document. https://tiptap.dev/api/commands/insert-content

ADH.caption: Content to be added
ADH.doc: The command is pretty flexible and takes plain text, HTML or even JSON as a value.
ADH.name: content

AFc.caption: To insert content at a certain position, give it a 'from'. You can also give it a 'to' value. Ensure that these values are non-negative integers.
AFc.name: info

AFf.caption: updateSelection
AFf.doc: controls if the selection should be moved to the newly inserted content
AFf.name: updateSelection

AEQ.caption: position
AEQ.doc: Focus the editor. By the default it restores the cursor position (and text selection)
AEQ.name: position

AER.caption: start: Set the cursor to the first position
AER.name: start

AES.caption: end: Set the cursor to the last position
AES.name: end

AEU.caption: number: Set the cursor to position xx
AEU.name: number

AFz.caption: Allowed MIME Types
AFz.doc: Which types of files are the users allowed to paste or drop in the editor. Typical types are 'image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'image/gif'. Leaving this blank will allow any file to be uploaded.
AFz.name: allowedMimeTypes

AEj.caption: CSS for base div // override
AEj.default_val: flex-grow: 1;     word-wrap: break-word; 	word-break: break-word; 	white-space: pre-wrap;
AEj.doc: gives you direct access to the div that holds the editor. This is also the last item in the CSS so you can override anything that precedes it.
AEj.name: baseDiv

AGH.caption: Element types
AGH.doc: Which elements should be tagged with the unique ID? Some typical options: heading, paragraph, image
AGH.name: extension_uniqueid_types

AFy.caption: Attach files to
AFy.doc: Bubble thing that it should attach files to
AFy.name: attachFilesTo

AFK.caption: Highlight CSS
AFK.doc: (beta) CSS properties for highlighted text. If you want more space to edit your text, use `arbitrary text`.
AFK.name: mark_adv

AFO.caption: link_unvisited_adv
AFO.doc: CSS properties for unvisited links. If you want more space to edit your text, use `arbitrary text`.
AFO.name: link_unvisited_adv

AGI.caption: Attribute name
AGI.doc: What name should the attribute have? Defaults to 'uid'. Each tagged element will have `data-uid=SOME_UNIQUE_ID` added to them.
AGI.name: extension_uniqueid_attrName

AGB.caption: Keep marks after
AGB.doc: Decides if to keep a mark after a hardbreak. When checked, and you're typing in bold, when you hit Shift+Enter, the next line will continue with bold. If unchecked, it will revert to normal text.
AGB.name: hardBreakKeepMarks

AFq.caption: Allow Base 64?
AFq.doc: Allow images to be parsed as base64 strings. When off Base64 images will remain in the code, but it won't be displayed.
AFq.name: allowBase64

AAK.caption: Initial content
AAK.doc: Content in Plain Text or HTML format. If JSON make sure the "Content is JSON?" is set to "yes".
AAK.name: initialContent

nodes.caption: Extensions
nodes.default_val: Heading, Bold, Code, Italic, Strike, Dropcursor, Gapcursor, History, Blockquote, BulletList, OrderedList, TaskList, CodeBlock, HorizontalRule, Youtube, Underline, Table, Image, Link, Placeholder, BubbleMenu, FloatingMenu, TextAlign, Highlight
nodes.doc: Active extensions. If you remove an item, the editor will not allow or render that node type. Possible options: Heading, Bold, Code, Italic, Strike, Dropcursor, Gapcursor, History, Blockquote, BulletList, OrderedList, TaskList, CodeBlock, HorizontalRule, Youtube, Underline, Table, Image, Link, Placeholder, BubbleMenu, FloatingMenu, TextAlign, Highlight
nodes.name: nodes

AGK.caption: The UniqueID extension adds unique IDs to nodes. Useful if you want to target a certain part of the text. You can configure which node types get an unique ID.
AGK.name: unique_id_info

h6_margin.caption: H6 margin
h6_margin.doc: e.g.: "1rem 0" means top & bottom 1rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
h6_margin.name: h6_margin

AFE.caption: Mentions allow you to @someone and link to that person. It's composed of a few parts.
AFE.name: mentions_sub

ADT.caption: H1 margin
ADT.doc: e.g.: "3rem 0" means top & bottom 3rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
ADT.name: h1_margin

ADq.caption: YouTube
ADq.doc: Add any CSS properties. FYI: The underlying item is an iFrame.
ADq.name: iframe

AFN.caption: link_adv
AFN.doc: CSS properties for all links. If you want more space to edit your text, use `arbitrary text`.
AFN.name: link_adv

AEx.caption: Type of content
AEx.doc: Which type of db thing should be displayed in the Mentions dropdown.
AEx.name: mention_list_type

ACS.caption: Floating menu
ACS.doc: ID of the group that holds the Floating Menu. This menu shows up on an empty line.
ACS.name: floatingMenu

h4_margin.caption: H4 margin
h4_margin.doc: e.g.: "1.5rem 0" means top & bottom 1.5rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
h4_margin.name: h4_margin

AFG.caption: preserveWhitespace
AFG.doc: By default, whitespace is collapsed as per HTML's rules. Pass true to preserve whitespace, but normalize newlines to spaces, and 'full' to preserve whitespace entirely.
AFG.name: parseOptions_preserveWhitespace

collab_url.caption: Custom - URL
collab_url.doc: Paste the collab URL here to enable collaborative editing. Leave empty to disable.
collab_url.name: collab_url

AFP.caption: link_visited_adv
AFP.doc: CSS properties for visited links. If you want more space to edit your text, use `arbitrary text`.
AFP.name: link_visited_adv

AFB.caption: Border color
AFB.doc: Color of the border around the mention on the text
AFB.name: mention_border_color

ADm.caption: Link hover adv
ADm.default_val: /*   text-decoration: wavy underline red;  */  /*   background: greenyellow; */
ADm.doc: ADVANCED FEATURE: Here you can enter any valid CSS to apply to hovered links.
ADm.name: link_hover_adv

AEE.caption: cursor_color
AEE.doc: In which color this user's name will show to other users.
AEE.name: collab_cursor_color

AEV.caption: Blockquote styling
AEV.doc: add any css to target the blockquote element. This will override the standard Tiptap (ProseMirror) styling.
AEV.name: blockquote_adv

ACL.caption: Bubble menu
ACL.doc: ID of the group that holds the Bubble Menu. This menu shows up when the user selects some text.
ACL.name: bubbleMenu

h3_margin.caption: H3 margin
h3_margin.doc: e.g.: "2rem 0" means top & bottom 2rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
h3_margin.name: h3_margin

h2_margin.caption: H2 margin
h2_margin.doc: e.g.: "2.5rem 0" means top & bottom 2.5rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
h2_margin.name: h2_margin

AEw.caption: Data source
AEw.doc: The list of items that should be displayed in the mentions dropdown. Usually a `do a search for...`
AEw.name: mention_list

ACZ.caption: Content is JSON?
ACZ.doc: In case your initial content is in JSON format. It needs to be a valid Tiptap JSON format. More info: https://tiptap.dev/guide/output#option-2-generate-html-from-prosemirror-json
ACZ.name: content_is_json

AEI.caption: Document name
AEI.doc: Name or id of the document. This should be a unique name like a slug or unique id.
AEI.name: collab_doc_id

AEH.caption: app_id
AEH.doc: Required for both Tiptap Cloud or Custom. Get the app id from ð—µð˜ð˜ð—½ð˜€://ð—¿ð—¶ð—°ð—¼.ð˜„ð˜ð—³ or ð—µð˜ð˜ð—½ð˜€://ð—°ð—¼ð—¹ð—¹ð—®ð—¯.ð˜ð—¶ð—½ð˜ð—®ð—½.ð—±ð—²ð˜ƒ
AEH.name: collab_app_id

AFQ.caption: link_focus_adv
AFQ.doc: CSS properties for focused links. If you want more space to edit your text, use `arbitrary text`.
AFQ.name: link_focus_adv

AEG.caption: to use the collaboration function you first need an account with one of the providers: ð—¿ð—¶ð—°ð—¼.ð˜„ð˜ð—³ (has free tier), ð—°ð—¼ð—¹ð—¹ð—®ð—¯.ð˜ð—¶ð—½ð˜ð—®ð—½.ð—±ð—²ð˜ƒ, or ð—¹ð—¶ð˜ƒð—²ð—¯ð—¹ð—¼ð—°ð—¸ð˜€.ð—¶ð—¼
AEG.name: collab_info_sub

ADQ.caption: Floating Menu Theme
ADQ.doc: The style of the tooltip box. See more here: https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v5/themes/
ADQ.name: floatingMenuTheme

ADp.caption: headings
ADp.doc: Enable headings. ðŸ,ðŸ will allow only heading 1 and heading 2, etc. Comma separated list of numbers from 1 to 6.
ADp.name: headings

AFC.caption: Background color
AFC.doc: Color of the background of the mention.
AFC.name: mention_background_color

AEm.caption: Liveblocks key
AEm.doc: Liveblocks public API key. If you're using Liveblocks, you need to provide this key.
AEm.name: liveblocksPublicApiKey

AEi.caption: Number list CSS
AEi.doc: styling for ordered lists (aka number lists). Use `padding-left: 20px;` if all you want to do is to align it to the text.
AEi.name: ol_adv

AEh.caption: Bullet lists CSS
AEh.doc: styling for unordered lists (aka bullet lists). You can use nested selectors to target child elements. Use `padding-left: 20px;` if all you want to do is to align it to the text.
AEh.name: ul_adv

AEN.caption: JWT key
AEN.doc: For both Tiptap Cloud or Custom collab, you need to provide a JWT key. Best idea is to create a workflow when the page loads, run ð—´ð—²ð—»ð—²ð—¿ð—®ð˜ð—² ð—ð—ªð—§ ð—¸ð—²ð˜† action, and store the token in a state on the page.
AEN.name: collab_jwt

ACA.caption: Placeholder
ACA.doc: The text that is displayed when the editor is empty. Make sure that it is selected in the Extensions panel below.
ACA.name: placeholder

AEk.caption: Provider
AEk.doc: Which collab provider you would like to use. Tiptap requires a subscription with cloud.tiptap.com and a JWT key. Liveblocks requires the plublic key. For custom requires the url of the server and a JWT.
AEk.name: collabProvider

ADP.caption: Bubble menu theme
ADP.doc: The style of the tooltip box. See more here: https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/v5/themes/
ADP.name: bubbleMenuTheme

h5_margin.caption: H5 margin
h5_margin.doc: e.g.: "1rem 0" means top & bottom 1rem, left & right 0.  Accepts CSS margin shorthand notation. For more info: google: "mdn CSS margin" OR ask in the forum thread.
h5_margin.name: h5_margin

AFF.caption: Update delay
AFF.doc: After the user stops typing, how long should it wait until it emits a "Content updated" event and -- if autobinding is on -- saves the document.
AFF.name: update_delay

AGA.caption: File upload URLs
AGA.doc: URLs of files that have been uploaded
AGA.name: fileUploadUrls

AFx.caption: File upload error message
AFx.doc: If there is an error, it will be shown here
AFx.name: fileUploadErrorMessage

AFn.caption: selectedHTML
AFn.doc: The current selection from block element to block element.
AFn.name: selectedHTML

AAJ.caption: Content (HTML)
AAJ.doc: Returns the current editor document as HTML
AAJ.name: contentHTML

ABF.caption: list item can be indented
ABF.doc: Sink or it can be indentend.
ABF.name: sinkListItem
